intro: Ilex venusta, commonly known as the evergreen holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Aquifoliaceae. It is native to the southeastern United States, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves that remain throughout the year. Its small, red berries are an important food source for various wildlife species. Ilex venusta is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
